ApathySam

Hypothetical question:
 
 Let's say at the moment you were conceived, a different sperm happened to fertilize the egg instead.
 
 The person that was born -- would that still be you? Would it be your consciousness (or soul) with a biologically different body and mind? Would the thought processes stay the same even though the mind is physically different?
 
 Basically, if the variables were changed, do you think you'd never have been born? Or do you think you would've still been born but in a different body?
 
 Whatever it is that makes you YOU (consciousness or soul or mind or whatever you want to call it), does it depend on mere birth order, or does it have to be the exact combination of sperm and egg? Could your consciousness/soul been born to different parents?
AMD4EVER

A tough question that probably has thousands of different possibilities.
 
 My belief is 'you' is nothing more than electrical impulses anyways and you are only convinced you exist because the impulses allow you to believe this. A human 'You' is simply the controller of a single brain program.
 
 Would the same controller exist if a different sperm or egg created the life you became? My guess would be no. It's all in how the circuitry of the mind is laid and it would have been laid differently.
 
 What are the odds that the conscious 'you' was ever even created? I'll bet the odds are about zero. Simple random chance. So even if God doesn't exist, it is still a miracle that your consciousness exists today.
 
 Another question to be posed is does an animal have a 'you' type (un)consciousness inside of them? Does 'you' even have to be conscious to exist? Does the 'you' need to believe it exists for it to exist? Since I believe 'you' is just a program, I don't think consciousness has to exist for a 'you' to exist in any given life form. But that leads me down the path of questioning whether each program written on a computer has a special 'you' as well and if it becomes conscious, does it truly become human?
gilligan8503

in theory, a computer program is not a being, but, if this computer program could achieve self-realization, then it could take over, begin writing by itself, and become a single being.
 
 *edit* sorry, when i say 'computer program', i mean artificial intelligence. *edit*

 All energy is consious. It remembers. It does not forget. This energy comes from the source. The code or information it carrys is what it remembers. Everything has consiousness. Your consiousness by is somewhat different. God can see through your eyes. This is why you are. There is no other reason for you to be. The energy that we speek of comes from the creator of all things. Your ability to ask why is Gods ability. You are part of God. What you define as consiousness is soul. If it were not you would be a rock. The rock remembers to hold together. It knows what it should be. So should you. Your ability to ask the question is why you are here.

 But can energy comprehend? Don't you need that to be conscious? Or do you think memory is all you need? Does that make bugs conscious?
 
 Actually I don't know why God needs me to be or I need to be because of God. God could make himself believe anything he wanted to or make the past anything he wanted it to be. What makes him want? Why does he want me to exist? Isn't he showing weakness by needing something?
 
 OK lets avoid a God debate. If you believe a soul is conscious and that you need one to be conscious, fine. Since we were just asking for opinions that will suffice.
Draconis

O.K. the vibrations of matter are actually one of the points of string theory, not souls. You must have been on one funny site mister. 
 
 And energy is not conscious, does a fire remember not to burn through the lining of a pool? No, if the lining is flammable the fire will burn the pool lining even if it almost got put out by doing that exact thing just seconds ago! 
 
 Finally a rock dosen't remember to hold together, in is under the constant influences of its atoms and their bonds which force it to hold together until something stronger or more resiliant breaks said rock apart. 
 
 But hey, if you want to believe energy is made of soul stuff and dreams instead of bosons, go ahead. Just thought you should know before you started preaching to your family!
jim's trucking

Consciousness resides in the brain only. You are conscious of your surroundings only because of inputs from your nervous system(s) to your brain. Your total history is stored in memory within the brain and is a compilation of all past inputs to your brain, every scene witnessed by your eyes, every sound interpreted by your ears, every pin XXXXX and chill felt by your skin.
 
 For a single species, it matters not whose sperm fertilized whose egg; if two offspring experience exactly the same inputs (a physical impossibility), these two beings would possess identical consciousnesses of their environment as long as they were not knocked unconscious by some ruffian. emoticon_xhoho

 I think your consciousness is a product of your experiences. two identical twins will behave totally different if placed in very different environments. even clones will act and think differently based on their interactions and personal experiences.

 Let's say at the moment you were conceived, a different sperm happened to fertilize the egg instead.
 
 The person that was born -- would that still be you? Would it be your consciousness (or soul) with a biologically different body and mind? Would the thought processes stay the same even though the mind is physically different?
 
 Basically, if the variables were changed, do you think you'd never have been born? Or do you think you would've still been born but in a different body?
 
 Whatever it is that makes you YOU (consciousness or soul or mind or whatever you want to call it), does it depend on mere birth order, or does it have to be the exact combination of sperm and egg? Could your consciousness/soul been born to different parents?
